page.title: 07BIRDLIFE AROUND LAUGHTON
page.content: I am writing this at the beginning of July, probably the best time to spot birds in Laughton. We are fortunate to have a terrific variety of birds. At school a robin has the front garden as its territory. Swallows and house martins have nested nearby: at the moment the parents are teaching their young to fly. There are some bluetits in my garden. In the fields around the church there are a lot of rooks, crows and jackdaws. If you look carefully you will see different members of the finch family. Kestrels and sparrowhawks often hover looking for prey. Various types of duck often fly overhead, and sometimes V-shaped formations of geese. Drivers in the lanes around Laughton frequently disturb magpies, jays and pheasants.
